Comment.Language: For the Commemoration of St. Victor:

Text.Language: Matamoi je k~se e~ywn: w~ Biktwr pamenrit n~s/ri: e~re pik/moc ,/ qen rwk: e~re niped/c qen nekjij.
Teach me where do you flee, O Victor my beloved son, for the muzzle is on your mouth, and the chains are on your hands.

Pejaf je ]se e~t~,wra: n~</mi e~ratf n~Armenioc: n~tamou e~jen v~ran m~paCwt/r: n~tef,a nanobi n/i e~bol.
He said "I fled to the land, of Egypt to Armenius, that I may die in the name of my Savior, and that He may forgive me my sins."

Pia~bot menenca vai: w~ Biktwr pamenrit n~s~/ri: ]cebtwt e~i~ri n~tekselet: n~ta] n~hanm/s n~,~r/ma nak.
"After that month, O Victor my beloved son, I am prepared to marry you off, and give you many riches."

Pac/ou a~nok taselet ,/: w~ Marya tamenri] m~mau: taselet te ]e~kkl/cia: papatselet pe pacwt/r.
"My time and my wedding will come, O Martha my beloved mother, for the Church is my wedding, and my Savior is my bridegroom."

<ere nak w~ pimarturoc: n~te peno#c# I/#c# P,#c#: ,ere piswij n~genneoc: pia~gioc apa Biktwr.
Hail to you O martyr, of our Lord Jesus Christ, hail to the courageous hero, the saint Abba Victor.
